content: @Alex Zhang I'm of the opinion that new defs should be in new files. There is very little cost to adding an extra import ... line, but a huge cost in modifying files that are basic in the import hierarchy. The downside to new files is worse discoverability, but that can be fixed with good docstrings.
I totally agree with you. @Eric Wieser is working on pulling proper things out. Some defs I added seem to be too simple to stand in a single file.
On the contrary, simple defs are definitely worth adding in a single file. Because the simplest defs imply the largest number of new lemmas.
Yes, I am considering writing things like permutation matrices in a new file. But the def seems to be also fit there currently.

The only reason I suggested that conj_transpose go in the existing file (in #8291) is because instance : star_ring is already there and what you're adding is clearly a more general case of that. I don't think that applies to the new definitions you're proposing in #8289.
I will remove the defns that are improperly fit.
By "simple" I mean, they don't have any encoded lemmas for now.
Kevin's rule-of-thumb is that any new definitions should have lemmas proven about them right away. There is a conceptual cost to adding new definitions.
